title: Period of SHM - spring constant period change

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to a horizontal spring with spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>. The block is displaced by a distance <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math> from equilibrium and released. The block takes time <math alttext="t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to return to its equilibrium position. The spring is then replaced with a different spring, and the block is displaced by a distance <math alttext="2 delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math> from equilibrium. The block returns to equilibrium in time <math alttext="the fraction t sub 0 over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>. What is the spring constant of the new spring?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
